metadata.title: CVE-2020-12419 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: When processing callbacks that occurred during window flushing in the parent process, the associated window may die; causing a use-after-free condition. This could have led to memory corruption and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 68.10, Firefox < 78, and Thunderbird < 68.10.0.

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
